titles.title: Where shall our wondering souls begin

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Where shall our wondering souls begin? How shall we all to Heaven aspire? As slaves redeemed from death and sin, As brands plucked from eternal fire, How shall we equal triumphs raise, Or sing our great Delivererâ€™s praise?

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh how shall we the goodness tell, Father, which Thou to us hast showed? Children of wrath, and doomed to hell, But children now redeemed to God, On earth we know our sins forgiven, Blessed with this antepast of Heaven!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Our heart is full of Christ, and long Their glorious matter to declare! Of him we make our loftier song, We cannot from his praise forbear; Our ready tongue makes haste to sing The glories of our heavenly King.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Fairer than all the earth-born race, Perfect in comeliness thou art; Replenished are thy lips with grace, And full of love thy tender heart: God ever blest! we bow the knee, And own all fulness dwells in thee.
